channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: When turning left into Nine Elms Road from the direction of Elmbridge Court, 22nd November
item.description:
On the junction outside 258 Cheltenham Road. About 1.5m from the kerb.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester

item.title: Rocking kerb stone, 22nd November
item.description:
Outside Flats 1-4, to vehicle underpass.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Park Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow lines on Merestones Road worn out, 22nd November
item.description:
This issue has been reported a number of times previously and appears to be wilfully ignored by the Local Authorities. These are so worn out that people are ignoring them and parking causing major issues at peak times for traffic travelling to and from the Merestones estate. The response given previously is nothing short of facetious and meaningless - "This enquiry has been addressed, no further updates will be shared here" Nothing has been done and the dangerous situation continues - when will some proper action be taken before someone is seriously hurt?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Merestones Drive, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Overgrown trees forcing kerb stones into road in Kensington Ave. damage to cars occurring, 22nd November
item.description:
The overgrown trees have huge roots that are now lifting the kerb stones and the road tarmac in Kensington Ave. Can you book replacement or resetting of the kerb stones? They are lethal.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Kensington Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Bridge purposely damaged, 22nd November
item.description:
The footbridge over the waterway has had several of its slats removed making crossing it difficult. This appears to have been done on purpose
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stump Lane, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous trees Kensington Ave, 22nd November
item.description:
Trees are overgrown and boughs splitting from trunk. Some boughs have broken off in the winds and fallen on cars below, but no people yet. They need to be pollarded properly they are dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Kensington Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Contaminated water is leaking from old top site and entering i to ditches, 22nd November
item.description:
What three words: ///custodial.hotspots.crate Contaminated water is leaking from old tip and entering into the ditches in the village. Water does leak out onto the road where people walk their pets.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Drains in Kensington Ave, 22nd November
item.description:
Drains continue to be blocked and works have not resolved the issue. When it rains the Ave floods from centre to entrance, approx 25m. The water rises up and over the kerb and floods the footpath as well as the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Kensington Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous trees, need to be pollarded, 22nd November
item.description:
The trees opposite 7,8,9 & 10 Kensington Ave have not been pollarded or pruned for a number of years. Many boughs now overgrown and splitting from the trunks. As large branches are breaking off and falling, they are falling on cars. If they fall on people they are likely to injure them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Kensington Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More KFC litter left in Arle Court underpass, 22nd November
item.description:
More KFC litter left in Arle Court underpass - still no bins in the underpass or realistic vicinity. Why the signs there if no bins?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arle Court Roundabout, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Shaving protruding undergrowth, Kensington Avenue GL50 2NQ - station street-side, 22nd November
item.description:
Overhanging hedges on station side of avenue, opposite nos 1A and 1. GL50 2NQ During w/c 11/10 a visit from 'highways' visited the avenue, with Police cones to cordon off the road infront of protruding hedges. As can be seen from this photo taken 7 days later, there has been no work party sent to shave the undergrowth. (problem first reported June 2024) Please inform residents of the latest information regarding this essential highways maintenance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Kensington Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
